What you'll doPosition: Product Associate IIIJob Location: 702 SW 8th St, Bentonville, AR 72712Telecommuting/working from home within the United States is permissible. Duties: Drives the product discovery process for small defined projects by collaborating with the Business, User Experience, and Engineering Teams during discovery to assess value, usability and feasibility of product features; specifying, prioritizing, and communicating high level and detailed product specifications; and using written specifications, business rules, flows, cases and user experience generated deliverables (for example, prototypes, wireframes, design and copy documents). Supports product implementation and deployment for small defined projects by engaging with Engineering and Project Management during implementation to answer questions and make scope trade off decisions; working closely with Marketing and the business to launch products and ensure their adoption; coordinating post-launch activities to validate that the product works as designed and that acceptance testing was successful; managing the development of training materials; training and supporting users on new product features; managing close-loop feedback cycles to encompass customer and user comments and needs; and defining, tracking and improving key product metrics. Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans by providing expert advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices; supporting and aligning efforts to meet customer and business needs; and building commitment for perspectives and rationalesMinimum education and experience required: Bachelor’s degree or the equivalent in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field plus 2 years of experience in product management or related experience; OR 4 years of product management or related experience.Skills required: Must have experience with: experience with Extraction, Transformation and Loading from various data sources (ETL); designing and implementing front end UI/UX platforms along with user training using backend programming language; experience with SQL development including using complex queries, stored procedures, and user defined functions; experience with Big Data, Hadoop data framework and Hibernate query language; designing, developing and configuring software products and systems as per user requirement; experience with relational, graph and/or unstructured data technologies such as SQL Server, HD Insights, Hadoop, and MySQL; experience with agile workstream using Jira to prioritize tasks and track backlogs; experience with architecting and designing technical solutions for cloud-based industry solutions using Azure IaaS, PaaS and SaaS capabilities; and experience with visualization tools such as Tableau and Power BI. Employer will accept any amount of experience with the required skills.Rate of pay: The annual salary range for this full-time position is $105,084.79/year to $170,000/year. Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance incentives.  Additional compensation for certain positions may also include: Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location) and Stock equity incentives.BenefitsAt Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet.•           Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage.•           Our financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance.•           Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty and voting.•           Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, education assistance with 100% company paid college degrees, company discounts, military service pay, adoption expense reimbursement, and more.Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.com.#LI-DNP #LI-DNIWal-Mart is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

2023 Inside Sales Campus Hire

Dell Technologies portfolio of emerging technologies is enough to get your pulse racing. But our customers are our heartbeat and deserve human interaction that is special and unique to their technological needs. Our Inside Sales Account Manager team is the driving force behind our high-level customer interaction. Our team is responsible for selling ground-breaking products by building relationships with customers using both the telephone and email as communication methods. Our Inside Sales Account Manager team ensures every customer interaction is exceptional and tailored to meet the customer.

Join us as an [ Account Manager] on our [Inside Sales] team in [Chengdu] to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact.

Key Responsibilities:
As an Inside Sales Account Manager, you will be responsible for selling our ground-breaking products by building relationships with customers through telephone and email conversations. It will be your job to ensure that every customer interaction is tailored and exceptional.

You will:
Work eagerly to gain new accounts and/or identify opportunities in account territory，occasionally support outside sales lead
Manage a high number of accounts
Demonstrate understanding of segment, product/service offerings and client set
Effectively articulate the value proposition associated with company products and services

Essential Requirements:
Mastery of the full range of products and services, and how these align to customer needs
Basic knowledge of tools and the ability to use multiple sales tools simultaneously to complete sales transactions
Basic customer relationship skills
2023 Master/Bachelor graduates, no major limitation

As a Telco Solutions Sales Engineer (Telecom Systems Business), you will be responsible for helping to lead Dell’s Telco as a Channel strategy with telco B2B organizationsto maximize the addressable market across multiple stakeholder organizations. You will coordinate the strategy and communication across the multiple Dell organizations that are focused on the Telco Channel business.  This involves tight alignment with Dell’s existing global alliances & channels organizations as well as strategic collaboration with Dell’s edge business unit.
You will:
Responsibilities / Expectations: 
Develop Telco partner plans that include prioritized offerings, account opportunities, resource mapping, gaps (in people and products) and other “blockers” to success (compensation, complexity, etc.)   
Manage sales pipeline across all phases of sales engagement (e.g., lead generation, pipeline development, & closure)  
Lead customer engagement with telco leadership to establish & execute joint GTM partnerships Support the development of Telecom Go-To-Market strategies and products for integrated solutions  
Facilitate integration of Dell’s Telecom Go-To-Market products and services with partner’s products and services to develop a common global strategy  
Understanding of the different types and models of Dell partner relationships, including Telecom, Cloud Service Provider, Systems Integrator, and Strategic Outsourcers 
Work with the Telco legal, business services, and partnership teams as needed to sign up Telco partners in the Dell Technologies Partner Program (CSP & SP)  
Take the first step towards your dream career
Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role:
Success measures: 
Achievement to Plan (reaching milestones on time) 
Attainment/Adoption of solutions (Sell-In, Sell-Out, and Resell metrics) 
Excitement for solution selling motion (surveys/interviews) 
Execution of campaign plans (activities/action) 
Creation of pipeline generation plans 
Pipeline tracking 
Essential Requirements:
8+ years of experience in Channel/Telecom 
Experience with Sales, Pre-Sales, Marketing and Finance 
Working with sales teams and having strong communication skills 
Strong Technical skills in: Telco Cloud Technologies, Cloud Service Provider Technologies 
Strong understanding of Service Provider market, requirements, technologies, drivers, and storage Technologies 
If you have the vision and tactical acumen help drive the success of strategic business opportunities for a global business, this is your opportunity to develop with Dell Technologies. 
Location: Singapore - some possible time in Dell Technologies Office, but mostly work from home and customer sites.
Regional travel to support sales motion (post COVID-19 “new normal” travel profile) 
This position is being staffed as a full-time role, that has a standard full-time work week 
“TelcoBU”

job_title: Salesforce Support Engineer - Secureworks - Hyderabad, India
job_desc:
Secureworks® (NASDAQ: SCWX) is a technology-driven cybersecurity leader that protects organizations in the digitally connected world. Built on proprietary technologies and world-class threat intelligence, our applications and solutions help prevent, detect, and respond to cyber threats.  Red Cloak™ software brings advanced threat analytics to thousands of customers, and the Secureworks Counter Threat Platform™ processes over 300B threat events per day. We understand complex security environments and are passionate about simplifying security with Defense in Concert™ so that security becomes a business enabler. More than 4,000 customers across over 50 countries are protected by Secureworks, benefit from our network effect and are Collectively Smarter. Exponentially Safer.™ www.secureworks.com.
We enjoy competitive compensation and benefits packages, and reward and recognize our employees for exceptional results. A constant focus on continued learning and growth keeps our team members engaged and excited about “what’s next.” We offer flexible work options when available, and emphasise the importance of work-life balance. We know that when our people are rewarded, recognized, and rejuvenated, we win as a team.  
Job Overview
Salesforce Support Engineer provides technical product support and have a passion to perform root cause analysis. In this role, you will communicate closely with technical and non-technical members of the business to resolve issues on time using analytical and programming skills to provide remediation plans forward.
Role & Responsibilities:
Assisting customers in troubleshooting their custom code, integration, and implementation of Salesforce products.
Coordinate with different teams on the integration points and bring resolution to the problems
Serve as an escalation point for internal support and product teams
Understand the business complexity and provide resolution/workaround to the user's problems
Create knowledge base materials dedicated towards operational efficiency
Support ongoing Salesforce administration (create accounts/profiles, workflow, approvals, reports, dashboards, etc.).
Provide minor changes in the code/configuration and able to deploy them into production
Develop and maintain technical expertise in assigned areas of product functionality and utilize that expertise effectively to help customers
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of Salesforce Sales, Services and Salesforce Community applications
Ability to work with teams across multiple time zones (Working from 2 PM to 11 PM IST)
Essential Requirements:
4-8 years of experience working on Salesforce platform
Lightning Experience
Experience using Salesforce data tools (Data Loader, Visual Studio Code, etc.)
Debugging/Troubleshooting Errors
SOQL/SOSL
WorkFlows/Process Builder
Desired Requirements:
Salesforce.com Certified Administrator (ADM201 Certified)
Experience with agile development methodologies like Scrum is a plus
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experience with MS SQL
Copado Release Management

Field Marketing Coordinator - Secureworks Japan - Tokyo/Otemachi
We are looking for an ambitious Marketing Coordinator to join our team and assist in go-to-market field activity.
As a Marketing Coordinator, you will support senior team members that work on developing, executing, and evaluating marketing campaigns. You will assist the marketing team by performing a variety of tasks, such as creating content for digital programs, writing ad copy, defining target audiences for different marketing initiatives, proofreading, and editing marketing materials, setting up email campaigns, and supporting the day-to-day lead management from marketing campaigns. 
You will work with the Marketing Manager to track and report on the progress of our campaigns using analytical tools and ensure operational elements of all campaigns are met to a high standard.
We are looking for a candidate who is knowledgeable in Field Marketing and is willing to learn. If you understand the basic principles of marketing and digital marketing campaigns and are happy to be a team player who provides support across the entire marketing process, this is a perfect role for you.
Responsibilities
Support the Marketing team with planning and executing marketing campaigns
Help with tracking and reporting campaign performance 
Ensure an uninterrupted stream of workflow by staying on top of program goals and deadlines
Support the proofreading/production/translation of marketing materials 
Update advertising copy, reports, and presentations 
Perform competitor analysis to identify industry best practices that will help us optimize existing campaigns and ensure the success of future ones
Execute digital events, webinars and partner sessions
QA email copy, and set up email campaigns
Track projects and team activities and assist in standardizing marketing materials
The day-to-day lead management from marketing campaigns
Collaboration with our DGR (Demand Generation Representative) team to optimize the performance
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field
1–2 years of experience in Marketing
Experience in Project Management is a plus
Excellent communication skills
Basic knowledge of various marketing principles
Working knowledge of web and analytics tools (CRM, automation tools) is a plus
Ability to work independently and be part of a collaborative team
An open mindset and will seek out feedback to refine and develop their skills.
Desirable Requirements
• Bachelor’s degree

10+ years B2B marketing experience –
5+ years’ experience of Marketing manager position at cybersecurity service and/or software companies
English communication capability for business level
MBA preferred

Team player who thrives in a fast-paced, matrix organization

Strong business acumen coupled with the ability to adapt to changing business conditions to offer our clients & stakeholders an exceptional level of service and meeting our business objectives.
Strong analytical skills and must be comfortable with data.
Excellent attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills - ability to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization (telephone, email & face-to-face).
Experience with marketing automation (Eloqua, Marketo, 6Sense, Demandbase); CRM (SFDC), analytics and reporting (Tableau, BI, Domo) required
Travel up to 25%

prepare response for review by tad and sign off by medical director, engage in inter-company dialogue and provide representation at pmcpa hearing if necessary.

job_title: Associate Director, Real World Market Access Analytics (RWVE)
job_desc: a minimum of a master’s degree is required, in a relevant discipline such as biostatistics, mathematics, economics, public health, health administration or operations research. a doctorate degree, phd, is preferred. a minimum of 6 years’ experience or 4 years’ experience with a doctorate degree, of relevant prior work experience is required. academic training and industry or payer experience in statistics, health economics, and outcomes research is required. proficiency in statistical programming (e.g. python, sas, r) is required. experience designing and conducting health economics and outcomes analytic required. experience with analytics, coding and management of administrative claims datasets, electronic health/medical records and/or clinical registry data required. deep understanding of claims database and electronic health records (ehr) is required experience developing and using economic and statistical models such as budget impact and cost effectiveness models, regression modeling techniques, mixed models, survival analysis, propensity score matching/modeling and non-parametric methods is required. scientific lead and project management experience is required self-motivation, self-initiation, and ability to meet deadlines are required ability to plan, organize, and work on multiple tasks simultaneously in different therapeutic areas are required strong written and oral communication skills are required. knowledge of medical terminologies (e.g. icd, ndc, gpi snomed, meddra, loinc, cpt) is required. experience with data visualization techniques such as with tableau and spotfire preferred. experience with novel techniques such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, predictive modelling is preferred. may require up to 10% travel.
